question: A body of mass 0.25 kg travels along a straight line from <katex>$x=0$</katex> to <katex>$x=2$</katex> m with a speed <katex>$v=kx^{3/2}$</katex> where <katex>$k=2$</katex> SI units. The work done by the net force during this displacement is
explanation: According to the Work-Energy Theorem, <katex>$W_{net} = \Delta KE$</katex>.
